Toggl Track is a time tracking applicati: Toggl Track es una aplicación de seguimiento de tiempo que permite a los usuarios rastrear sus actividades diarias en diferentes plataformas.
\n 1. Log in to your Toggl Track accoun:
1. Log in to your Toggl Track account.
  2. Go to your **Profile settings**.
  3. Find the **API Token** at the bottom of the page and copy it.

Project color in hex format (e.g. #ff000: Color del proyecto en formato hexadecimal (ej. #ff0000).
Whether estimates are based on task hour: Si las estimaciones se basan en horas de tareas. (Característica Premium)
Estimated hours for the project. (Premiu: Horas estimadas para el proyecto. (Característica Premium)
Hourly rate for the project. (Premium fe: Precio por hora para el proyecto. (Característica Premium)
Start date of project timeframe (YYYY-MM: Fecha de inicio del plazo del proyecto (AAA-MM-DD).
End date of project timeframe (YYYY-MM-D: Fecha de fin del plazo del proyecto (AAA-MM-DD).
El proyecto bajo el que crear la tarea.
El nombre de la nueva tarea.
The estimated time for the task in secon: El tiempo estimado para la tarea en segundos.
External reference to link this task wit: Referencia externa para vincular esta tarea con sistemas externos.
Whether the task is active. Use false to: Si la tarea está activa. Use false para marcar como hecho.
Creator ID, if omitted, will use request: El ID de creador, si se omite, usará el ID de usuario solicitante.
El nombre de la nueva etiqueta.
Hora de inicio de la entrada en UTC.
Duration of the time entry. Use a negati: Duración de la entrada de hora. Utilice un número negativo (por ejemplo, -1) para iniciar un temporizador en ejecución.
The stop time of the entry in UTC. Can b: El tiempo de parada de la entrada en UTC. Se puede omitir si se sigue ejecutando.
The project to associate the time entry: El proyecto para asociar la entrada de tiempo.
Tags to associate with the time entry. Y: Etiquetas para asociar con la entrada de tiempo. Puedes crear nuevas etiquetas escribiéndolas.
Whether the time entry is marked as bill: Si la entrada de tiempo está marcada como facturable.
Time entry creator ID. If omitted, will: ID del creador de la entrada de tiempo. Si se omite, se utilizará el ID del usuario solicitante.
La organización en la que operar.
El nombre o correo electrónico del usuario a encontrar.
Número de página para la paginación.
El nombre del proyecto a encontrar.
Return active, inactive, or both types o: Regresa activa, inactiva o ambos tipos de proyectos.
Get only projects assigned to the curren: Obtener sólo proyectos asignados al usuario actual.
Número de elementos por página (por defecto 50).
The name of the client to find (case-ins: El nombre del cliente a encontrar (mayúsculas y minúsculas).
Search for time entries containing this: Buscar entradas de tiempo que contengan este texto en la descripción.
Get entries from start_date (YYYY-MM-DD: Obtener entradas del formato start_date (formato AAA-MM-DD o RFC3339).
Get entries until end_date (YYYY-MM-DD o: Obtener entradas hasta el formato end_date (formato AAA-MM-DD o RFC3339).
Get entries before given date (YYYY-MM-D: Obtener entradas antes de la fecha indicada (formato YYYY-MM-DD o RFC3339).
Get entries modified since this UNIX tim: Obtener entradas modificadas desde esta marca de tiempo UNIX.
Should the response contain data for met: Si la respuesta contiene datos para las entidades meta.
Incluye compartir detalles en la respuesta.
Name: Nombre
New or Updated Workspace: Espacio de trabajo nuevo o actualizado
Fires when a new client is created in a: Dispara cuando un nuevo cliente es creado en un espacio de trabajo.
Fires when a workspace is created or upd: Dispara cuando se crea o actualiza un área de trabajo (Toggl sólo soporta eventos actualizados).
Dispara cuando se añade un nuevo proyecto.
Dispara cuando se crea una nueva tarea.
Fires when a new time entry is added (wi: Dispara cuando se añade una nueva entrada de tiempo (con filtro opcional de proyecto/tarea).
Fires when a new time entry is started a: Dispara cuando se inicia una nueva entrada de tiempo y se está ejecutando actualmente.
Triggers when a new tag is created: Dispara cuando se crea una nueva etiqueta

## Setup Instructions

To use this trigger, you need to manually create a webhook in your Toggl Track account:

### 1. Access Toggl Track Webhooks
- Log in to your Toggl Track account
- Go to **Integrations > Webhooks** (Admin access required)
- Click **"Create Webhook"** or **"Create your first webhook"**

### 2. Configure the Webhook
1. **Name**: Enter a descriptive name (e.g., "Activepieces New Client")
2. **Events**: Select **"Client created"** from the events dropdown
3. **URL Endpoint**: Paste this webhook URL:
```text
{{webhookUrl}}
```
4. **Secret**: Enter a secret key for security (optional but recommended)

### 3. Complete Setup
- Click **"Add Webhook"**
- Toggl Track will validate your endpoint
- The webhook will appear in your webhooks list when ready

### 4. Verification
- Your webhook status should show as **"Validated"** (happens automatically)
- You can use the **"Test"** option to verify it's working
- Create a test client to ensure events are received

---

**Requirements:**
- Admin permissions in your Toggl Track workspace
- Limit: 5 webhooks per workspace user

**Event Details:**
This trigger will fire when clients are created and will include:
- Client ID and details
- Workspace information
- Creation timestamp
- Creator information
- Client notes and status

**Troubleshooting:**
- If status shows **"Not validated"**, click "Test" to trigger auto-validation
- If status shows **"Disabled"**, re-enable it from the 3-dot menu
- If events aren't received, verify you selected "Client created" event

**Note:** This trigger uses manual webhook setup as recommended by Toggl Track. **Validation happens automatically** when you click "Test" or when Toggl sends the first ping. The webhook will be managed through your Toggl Track dashboard, not programmatically through ActivePieces.

## Setup Instructions

To use this trigger, you need to manually create a webhook in your Toggl Track account:

### 1. Access Toggl Track Webhooks
- Log in to your Toggl Track account
- Go to **Integrations > Webhooks** (Admin access required)
- Click **"Create Webhook"** or **"Create your first webhook"**

### 2. Configure the Webhook
1. **Name**: Enter a descriptive name (e.g., "Activepieces New Project")
2. **Events**: Select **"Project created"** from the events dropdown
3. **URL Endpoint**: Paste this webhook URL:
```text
{{webhookUrl}}
```
4. **Secret**: Enter a secret key for security (optional but recommended)

### 3. Complete Setup
- Click **"Add Webhook"**
- Toggl Track will validate your endpoint
- The webhook will appear in your webhooks list when ready

### 4. Verification
- Your webhook status should show as **"Validated"** (happens automatically)
- You can use the **"Test"** option to verify it's working
- Create a test project to ensure events are received

---

**Requirements:**
- Admin permissions in your Toggl Track workspace
- Limit: 5 webhooks per workspace user

**Event Details:**
This trigger will fire when projects are created and will include:
- Project ID and details
- Workspace information
- Client association (if any)
- Creation timestamp
- Creator information
- Project settings (color, billable status, etc.)

**Troubleshooting:**
- If status shows **"Not validated"**, click "Test" to trigger auto-validation
- If status shows **"Disabled"**, re-enable it from the 3-dot menu
- If events aren't received, verify you selected "Project created" event

**Note:** This trigger uses manual webhook setup as recommended by Toggl Track. **Validation happens automatically** when you click "Test" or when Toggl sends the first ping. The webhook will be managed through your Toggl Track dashboard, not programmatically through ActivePieces.

## Setup Instructions

To use this trigger, you need to manually create a webhook in your Toggl Track account:

### 1. Access Toggl Track Webhooks
- Log in to your Toggl Track account
- Go to **Integrations > Webhooks** (Admin access required)
- Click **"Create Webhook"** or **"Create your first webhook"**

### 2. Configure the Webhook
1. **Name**: Enter a descriptive name (e.g., "Activepieces New Task")
2. **Events**: Select **"Task created"** from the events dropdown
3. **URL Endpoint**: Paste this webhook URL:
```text
{{webhookUrl}}
```
4. **Secret**: Enter a secret key for security (optional but recommended)

### 3. Complete Setup
- Click **"Add Webhook"**
- Toggl Track will validate your endpoint
- The webhook will appear in your webhooks list when ready

### 4. Verification
- Your webhook status should show as **"Validated"** (happens automatically)
- You can use the **"Test"** option to verify it's working
- Create a test task to ensure events are received

---

**Requirements:**
- Admin permissions in your Toggl Track workspace
- Limit: 5 webhooks per workspace user

**Event Details:**
This trigger will fire when tasks are created and will include:
- Task ID and details
- Project association
- Workspace information
- Creation timestamp
- Creator information
- Task settings (estimated time, active status, etc.)

**Note:** You can filter tasks by project using the optional project filter above.

**Troubleshooting:**
- If status shows **"Not validated"**, click "Test" to trigger auto-validation
- If status shows **"Disabled"**, re-enable it from the 3-dot menu
- If events aren't received, verify you selected "Task created" event

**Note:** This trigger uses manual webhook setup as recommended by Toggl Track. **Validation happens automatically** when you click "Test" or when Toggl sends the first ping. The webhook will be managed through your Toggl Track dashboard, not programmatically through ActivePieces.

## Setup Instructions

To use this trigger, you need to manually create a webhook in your Toggl Track account:

### 1. Access Toggl Track Webhooks
- Log in to your Toggl Track account
- Go to **Integrations > Webhooks** (Admin access required)
- Click **"Create Webhook"** or **"Create your first webhook"**

### 2. Configure the Webhook
1. **Name**: Enter a descriptive name (e.g., "Activepieces New Time Entry")
2. **Events**: Select **"Time entry created"** from the events dropdown
3. **URL Endpoint**: Paste this webhook URL:
```text
{{webhookUrl}}
```
4. **Secret**: Enter a secret key for security (optional but recommended)

### 3. Complete Setup
- Click **"Add Webhook"**
- Toggl Track will validate your endpoint
- The webhook will appear in your webhooks list when ready

### 4. Verification
- Your webhook status should show as **"Validated"** (happens automatically)
- You can use the **"Test"** option to verify it's working
- Create a test time entry to ensure events are received

---

**Requirements:**
- Admin permissions in your Toggl Track workspace
- Limit: 5 webhooks per workspace user

**Event Details:**
This trigger will fire when time entries are created and will include:
- Time entry ID and details
- Start/stop times and duration
- Project and task associations (if any)
- Workspace information
- Description and tags
- Creator information
- Billable status

**Note:** You can filter time entries by project and task using the optional filters above.

**Troubleshooting:**
- If status shows **"Not validated"**, click "Test" to trigger auto-validation
- If status shows **"Disabled"**, re-enable it from the 3-dot menu
- If events aren't received, verify you selected "Time entry created" event

**Note:** This trigger uses manual webhook setup as recommended by Toggl Track. **Validation happens automatically** when you click "Test" or when Toggl sends the first ping. The webhook will be managed through your Toggl Track dashboard, not programmatically through ActivePieces.
